00050 // 
00051 // ctor
00052 // 
00053 // Purpose:     Construct CXEventLog object.
00054 // 
00055 // Parameters:  lpszApp             - name of app (event log source).  This 
00056 //                                    parameter is optional. If it is not
00057 //                                    specified, Init() must be called separately.
00058 //              lpszEventMessageDll - fully-qualified name of event message
00059 //                                    dll. Includes complete path and file 
00060 //                                    name. Example: "C:\\bin\\MyMessage.dll".
00061 //                                    This parameter is optional.
00062 // 
00063 // Returns:     None
00064 //
00065 CXEventLog::CXEventLog(LPCTSTR lpszApp /*= NULL*/,
00066                                            LPCTSTR lpszEventMessageDll /*= NULL*/)
00067 {
00068 #ifdef _DEBUG
00069         if ((lpszApp == NULL) || (lpszApp[0] == _T('\0')))
00070         {
00071                 TRACE(_T("=== No app specified in CXEventLog ctor. ")
00072                           _T("Be sure to call Init() before calling Write(). ===\n"));
00073         }
00074 #endif
00075 
00076         m_hEventLog = NULL;
00077         m_pszAppName = NULL;
00078 
00079         BOOL bRet = FALSE;
00080 
00081         // open event log
00082         if (lpszApp && (lpszApp[0] != _T('\0')))
00083                 bRet = Init(lpszApp, lpszEventMessageDll);
00084 }
00085 
00087 // 
00088 // dtor
00089 // 
00090 // Purpose:     Destroy CXEventLog object.
00091 // 
00092 // Parameters:  none
00093 // 
00094 // Returns:     none
00095 // 
00096 CXEventLog::~CXEventLog()
00097 {
00098         Close();
00099         if (m_pszAppName)
00100                 delete [] m_pszAppName;
00101         m_pszAppName = NULL;
00102 }
00103 
00105 // 
00106 // Close()
00107 // 
00108 // Purpose:     Close event log handle.  Called automatically by dtor.
00109 // 
00110 // Parameters:  none
00111 // 
00112 // Returns:     none
00113 // 
00114 void CXEventLog::Close()
00115 {
00116         if (m_hEventLog)
00117                 ::DeregisterEventSource(m_hEventLog);
00118         m_hEventLog = NULL;
00119 }
00120 
00122 // 
00123 // GetAppName()
00124 // 
00125 // Purpose:     Get name of currently registered app.
00126 // 
00127 // Parameters:  none
00128 // 
00129 // Returns:     LPTSTR - app name
00130 // 
00131 LPTSTR CXEventLog::GetAppName()
00132 {
00133         return m_pszAppName;
00134 }
00135 
00137 // 
00138 // Init()
00139 // 
00140 // Purpose:     Initialize the registry for event logging from this app.
00141 //              Normally Init() is called from ctor.  If default ctor (no args)
00142 //              is used, then Init() must be called before Write() is called.
00143 //              Sets class variable m_hEventLog.
00144 // 
00145 // Parameters:  lpszApp             - name of app (event log source).  
00146 //                                    MUST BE SPECIFIED.
00147 //              lpszEventMessageDll - fully-qualified name of event message
00148 //                                    dll. Includes complete path and file 
00149 //                                    name. Example: "C:\\bin\\MyMessage.dll".
00150 //                                    This parameter is optional.
00151 // 
00152 // Returns:     BOOL - TRUE = success
00153 //
00154 BOOL CXEventLog::Init(LPCTSTR lpszApp, LPCTSTR lpszEventMessageDll /*= NULL*/)
00155 {
00156         _ASSERTE((lpszApp != NULL) && (lpszApp[0] != _T('\0')));
00157         if (!lpszApp || lpszApp[0] == _T('\0'))
00158                 return FALSE;
00159 
00160         Close();                // close event log if already open
00161 
00162         SetAppName(lpszApp);
00163 
00164         BOOL bRet = RegisterSource(lpszApp, lpszEventMessageDll);
00165         _ASSERTE(bRet);
00166 
00167         if (bRet)
00168         {
00169                 m_hEventLog = ::RegisterEventSource(NULL, lpszApp);
00170         }
00171         else
00172         {
00173                 TRACE(_T("RegisterSource failed\n"));
00174         }
00175 
00176         _ASSERTE(m_hEventLog != NULL);
00177 
00178         return (m_hEventLog != NULL);
00179 }
00180 
00182 // 
00183 // Write()
00184 // 
00185 // Purpose:     Write string to event log
00186 // 
00187 // Parameters:  wType - event type.  See ReportEvent() in MSDN for complete list.
00188 //              lpszMessage - string to log
00189 // 
00190 // Returns:     BOOL - TRUE = success
00191 // 
00192 BOOL CXEventLog::Write(WORD wType, LPCTSTR lpszMessage)
00193 {
00194         BOOL bRet = TRUE;
00195 
00196         _ASSERTE(m_hEventLog != NULL);
00197         if (!m_hEventLog)
00198         {
00199                 // Init() not called
00200                 return FALSE;
00201         }
00202 
00203         _ASSERTE(lpszMessage != NULL);
00204         if (!lpszMessage)
00205                 return FALSE;
00206 
00207         _ASSERTE((wType == EVENTLOG_ERROR_TYPE)       ||
00208                          (wType == EVENTLOG_WARNING_TYPE)     ||
00209                          (wType == EVENTLOG_INFORMATION_TYPE) ||
00210                          (wType == EVENTLOG_AUDIT_SUCCESS)    ||
00211                          (wType == EVENTLOG_AUDIT_FAILURE));
00212 
00213         // get our user name information
00214         PSID pSid = GetUserSid();
00215 
00216         LPCTSTR* lpStrings = &lpszMessage;
00217 
00218         bRet = ::ReportEvent(m_hEventLog,               // event log source handle
00219                                                  wType,                         // event type to log
00220                                                  0,                                     // event category
00221                                                  0x20000001L,           // event identifier (GENERIC_MESSAGE)
00222                                                  pSid,                          // user security identifier (optional)
00223                                                  1,                                     // number of strings to merge with message
00224                                                  0,                                     // size of binary data, in bytes
00225                                                  lpStrings,                     // array of strings to merge with message
00226                                                  NULL);                         // address of binary data
00227 
00228         if (pSid)
00229                 HeapFree(GetProcessHeap(), 0, pSid);
00230 
00231         return bRet;
00232 }
00233

00237 //
00238 //                          INTERNAL METHODS
00239 //
00242 
00243 
00245 // 
00246 // RegisterSource() - INTERNAL METHOD
00247 // 
00248 // Purpose:     Create entry in registry for message DLL.  This method will
00249 //              create the following registry keys:
00250 //                 HKLM
00251 //                    SYSTEM
00252 //                       CurrentControlSet
00253 //                          Services
00254 //                             Eventlog
00255 //                                Application
00256 //                                   <app name>
00257 //                                       EventMessageFile = <complete path to message DLL>
00258 //                                       TypesSupported   = 0x0000001f (31)
00259 //                
00260 //              Note that <app name> is the lpszApp parameter, and 
00261 //              <complete path to message DLL> is the lpszEventMessageDll 
00262 //              parameter.
00263 //  
00264 // Parameters:  lpszApp             - name of app (event log source).  
00265 //              lpszEventMessageDll - fully-qualified name of event message
00266 //                                    DLL. Includes complete path and file 
00267 //                                    name. Example: "C:\\bin\\MyMessage.dll".
00268 //                                    If this parameter is NULL, default is to
00269 //                                    use exe's path + "XEventMessage.dll".
00270 // 
00271 // Returns:     BOOL - TRUE = success
00272 //
00273 BOOL CXEventLog::RegisterSource(LPCTSTR lpszApp,
00274                                                                 LPCTSTR lpszEventMessageDll)
00275 {
00276         _ASSERTE((lpszApp != NULL) && (lpszApp[0] != _T('\0')));
00277         if (!lpszApp || lpszApp[0] == _T('\0'))
00278                 return FALSE;
00279 
00280         TCHAR * szRegPath = 
00281                 _T("SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Services\\Eventlog\\Application\\");
00282 
00283         TCHAR szKey[_MAX_PATH*2];
00284         memset(szKey, 0, _MAX_PATH*2*sizeof(TCHAR));
00285         _tcscpy(szKey, szRegPath);
00286         _tcscat(szKey, lpszApp);
00287         TRACE(_T("szKey=<%s>\n"), szKey);
00288 
00289         // open the registry event source key
00290         DWORD dwResult = 0;
00291         HKEY hKey = NULL;
00292         LONG lRet = ::RegCreateKeyEx(HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, szKey, 0, NULL,
00293                                         REG_OPTION_NON_VOLATILE, KEY_ALL_ACCESS, NULL, &hKey, &dwResult);
00294 
00295         if (lRet == ERROR_SUCCESS)
00296         {
00297                 // registry key was opened or created -
00298 
00299                 // === write EventMessageFile key ===
00300 
00301                 TCHAR szPathName[_MAX_PATH*2];
00302                 memset(szPathName, 0, _MAX_PATH*2*sizeof(TCHAR));
00303 
00304                 if (lpszEventMessageDll)
00305                 {
00306                         // if dll path was specified use that - note that this
00307                         // must be complete path + dll filename
00308                         _tcsncpy(szPathName, lpszEventMessageDll, _MAX_PATH*2-2);
00309                 }
00310                 else
00311                 {
00312                         // use app's directory + "XEventMessage.dll"
00313                         ::GetModuleFileName(NULL, szPathName, MAX_PATH*2-2);
00314 
00315                         TCHAR *cp = _tcsrchr(szPathName, _T('\\'));
00316                         if (cp != NULL)
00317                                 *cp = _T('\0');
00318 
00319                         _tcscat(szPathName, _T("\\XEventMessage.dll"));
00320                 }
00321 
00322                 TRACE(_T("szPathName=<%s>\n"), szPathName);
00323 
00324                 ::RegSetValueEx(hKey,  _T("EventMessageFile"), 0, REG_SZ,
00325                         (const BYTE *) szPathName, (_tcslen(szPathName) + 1)*sizeof(TCHAR));
00326 
00327                 // === write TypesSupported key ===
00328 
00329                 // message DLL supports all types
00330                 DWORD dwSupportedTypes = EVENTLOG_ERROR_TYPE            |
00331                                                                  EVENTLOG_WARNING_TYPE          |
00332                                                                  EVENTLOG_INFORMATION_TYPE      |
00333                                                                  EVENTLOG_AUDIT_SUCCESS         |
00334                                                                  EVENTLOG_AUDIT_FAILURE;
00335 
00336                 ::RegSetValueEx(hKey, _T("TypesSupported"), 0, REG_DWORD,
00337                         (const BYTE *) &dwSupportedTypes, sizeof(DWORD));
00338 
00339                 ::RegCloseKey(hKey);
00340 
00341                 return TRUE;
00342         }
00343 
00344         return FALSE;
00345 }
00346 
00348 // 
00349 // GetUserSid() - INTERNAL METHOD
00350 // 
00351 // Purpose:     Get SID of current user
00352 // 
00353 // Parameters:  none
00354 // 
00355 // Returns:     PSID - pointer to alloc'd SID; must be freed by caller.
00356 //              Example:  HeapFree(GetProcessHeap(), 0, pSid);
00357 // 
00358 PSID CXEventLog::GetUserSid()
00359 {
00360         HANDLE       hToken   = NULL;
00361         PTOKEN_USER  ptiUser  = NULL;
00362         DWORD        cbti     = 0;
00363 
00364         // get calling thread's access token
00365         if (!OpenThreadToken(GetCurrentThread(), TOKEN_QUERY, TRUE,     &hToken)) 
00366         {
00367                 if (GetLastError() != ERROR_NO_TOKEN)
00368                         return NULL;
00369 
00370                 // retry for process token if no thread token exists
00371                 if (!OpenProcessToken(GetCurrentProcess(), TOKEN_QUERY, &hToken))
00372                         return NULL;
00373         }
00374 
00375         // get size of the user information in the token
00376         if (GetTokenInformation(hToken, TokenUser, NULL, 0, &cbti)) 
00377         {
00378                 // call should have failed due to zero-length buffer.
00379                 return NULL;
00380         } 
00381         else 
00382         {
00383                 // call should have failed due to zero-length buffer
00384                 if (GetLastError() != ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_BUFFER)
00385                         return NULL;
00386         }
00387 
00388         // allocate buffer for user information in the token
00389         ptiUser = (PTOKEN_USER) HeapAlloc(GetProcessHeap(), 0, cbti);
00390         if (!ptiUser)
00391                 return NULL;
00392 
00393         // retrieve the user information from the token
00394         if (!GetTokenInformation(hToken, TokenUser, ptiUser, cbti, &cbti))
00395                 return NULL;
00396 
00397         DWORD dwLen = ::GetLengthSid(ptiUser->User.Sid);
00398 
00399         // allocate buffer for SID
00400         PSID psid = (PSID) HeapAlloc(GetProcessHeap(), 0, dwLen);
00401         if (!psid)
00402                 return NULL;
00403 
00404         BOOL bRet = ::CopySid(dwLen, psid, ptiUser->User.Sid);
00405         if (!bRet)
00406                 return NULL;
00407 
00408         // close access token
00409         if (hToken)
00410                 CloseHandle(hToken);
00411 
00412         if (ptiUser)
00413                 HeapFree(GetProcessHeap(), 0, ptiUser);
00414 
00415         return psid;
00416 } 
00417 
00419 // 
00420 // SetAppName() - INTERNAL METHOD
00421 // 
00422 // Purpose:     Stores name of current app
00423 // 
00424 // Parameters:  lpszApp - app name
00425 // 
00426 // Returns:     none
00427 // 
00428 void CXEventLog::SetAppName(LPCTSTR lpszApp)
00429 {
00430         if (!lpszApp)
00431                 return;
00432         if (!m_pszAppName)
00433                 m_pszAppName = new TCHAR [_MAX_PATH*2];
00434         if (m_pszAppName)
00435         {
00436                 memset(m_pszAppName, 0, _MAX_PATH*2*sizeof(TCHAR));
00437                 _tcsncpy(m_pszAppName, lpszApp, _MAX_PATH*2-2);
00438         }
00439 }
